standard_metadata.standard_description: Read, write, and compare decimals to thousandths.

question.content: **Write nine and three hundred twenty-one thousandths in decimal notation.**

hints.content: The number is $\goldE{\text{nine}}$ and $\tealE{\text{three hundred}}$ $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$.  The last place value in the number is *thousandths*, so the number ends in the *thousandths* place.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $?$ | $?$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$ | $?$
The $\text{and}$ tells us where to put the decimal.  $\goldE{\text{Nine}}.\tealE{\text{three hundred}}$ $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$.

We write $\text{\goldE{nine}}$ to the left side of the decimal as $\goldE9$.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $?$ | $\goldE{9}$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

We write $\text{\tealE{three hundred}}$ $\text{\purpleD{twenty-}}\text{\maroonD{one}}\text{\maroonD{ thousandths}}$ to the right side of the decimal as $\tealE3\purpleD{2}\maroonD{1}$ .  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | $\goldE{9}$ |$.$  | $\tealE3$ | $\purpleD{2}$ | $\maroonD{1}$
The number $\goldE{\text{nine}}$ and $\tealE{\text{three hundred}}$ $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$ in decimal notation is $\goldE{9}.\tealE3\purpleD{2}\maroonD{1}$.

question.content: **Write two hundred six and four tenths in decimal notation.**

hints.content: The number is $\tealE{\text{two hundred}}$ $\goldE{\text{six}}$ and $\maroonE{\text{four tenths}}$. The last place value in the number is *tenths*, so the number ends in the *tenths* place.  Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $?$ | $?$ |$?$  | $.$ | $?$
The $\text{and}$ tells us where to put the decimal.  $\tealE{\text{Two hundred}}\goldE{\text{ six}}.\maroonE{\text{four tenths}}$

We write $\tealE{\text{two hundred}}\goldE{\text{ six}}$ to the left side of the decimal as $\tealE20\goldE6$.  Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\tealE2$ | $0$ | $\goldE{6}$ |$.$  | $?$

We write $\maroonE{\text{four tenths}}$ to the right side of the decimal  as $\maroonE{4}$ .  Hundreds | Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\tealE2$ | $0$ | $\goldE{6}$ |$.$  | $\maroonE{4}$
The number $\tealE{\text{two hundred}}$ $\goldE{\text{six}}$ and $\maroonE{\text{four tenths}}$ in decimal notation is $\tealE20\goldE{6}.\maroonE{4}$.

We write $\tealE{\text{eight hundred}}$ $\purpleD{\text{seventy}}$-$\maroonD{\text{three thousandths}}$ to the right side of the decimal as $\tealE8\purpleD{7}\maroonD{3}$. The number $\goldE{\text{six}}$ and $\tealE{\text{eight hundred}}$ $\purpleD{\text{seventy}}$-$\maroonD{\text{three thousandths}}$ in decimal notation is $\goldE{6}.\tealE8\purpleD{7}\maroonD{3}$.

We write $\purpleD{\text{forty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{two thousandths}}$ to the right side of the decimal as $\purpleD{4}\maroonD{2}$.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | $\goldE{2}$ |$.$  | $0$ | $\purpleD{4}$ | $\maroonD{2}$

question.content: **Write one hundred twenty-one and twenty-one thousandths in decimal notation.**

hints.content: The number is $\redE{\text{one hundred}}\goldE{\text{ twenty-}}\tealE{\text{one}}$ and $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$.  The last place value in the number is *thousandths*, so the number ends in the *thousandths* place.  Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:| :-: $?$| $?$ | $?$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$ | $?$
The $\text{and}$ tells us where to put the decimal.  $\redE{\text{One hundred}}\goldE{\text{ twenty-}}\tealE{\text{one}}.$$\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$

We write $\redE{\text{one hundred}}\goldE{\text{ twenty-}}\tealE{\text{one}}$ to the left side of the decimal as $\redE1\goldE2\tealE1$.  Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\redE1$| $\goldE2$ | $\tealE1$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$ | $?$

We write $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$ to the right side of the decimal as $\purpleD{2}\maroonD{1}$ .  Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\redE1$| $\goldE2$ | $\tealE1$ |$.$  | $0$ | $\purpleD2$ | $\maroonD1$

The number $\redE{\text{one hundred}}\goldE{\text{ twenty-}}\tealE{\text{one}}$ and $\purpleD{\text{twenty}}$-$\maroonD{\text{one thousandths}}$ in decimal notation is $\redE1\goldE2\tealE1.0\purpleD{2}\maroonD{1}$.

The $\text{and}$ tells us where to put the decimal.  $\goldE{\text{Eighty}}.\tealE{\text{fifteen hundredths}}$
We write $\goldE{\text{eighty}}$ to the left side of the decimal as $\goldE{80}$.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\goldE8$ | $\goldE{0}$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$

We write $\tealE{\text{fifteen hundredths}}$ to the right side of the decimal as $\tealE{15}$ .  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\goldE8$| $\goldE{0}$ |$.$  | $\tealE1$ | $\tealE5$
The number $\goldE{\text{eighty}}$ and $\tealE{\text{fifteen hundredths}}$ in decimal notation is $\goldE{80}.\tealE{15}$.

question.content: **Write five hundred seven and seven hundredths in decimal notation.**

hints.content: The number is $\goldE{\text{five hundred}}\tealE{\text{ seven}}$ and $\purpleD{\text{seven hundredths}}$. The $\text{and}$ tells us where to put the decimal.  $\goldE{\text{Five hundred}}\tealE{\text{ seven}}.$$\purpleD{\text{seven hundredths}}$.

We write $\goldE{\text{five hundred}}\tealE{\text{ seven}}$ to the left side of the decimal as $\goldE50\tealE7$.  Hundreds| Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: $\goldE5$| $0$ | $\tealE7$ |$.$  | $?$ | $?$

The number $\goldE{\text{five hundred}}\tealE{\text{ seven}}$ and $\purpleD{\text{seven hundredths}}$ in decimal notation is $\goldE50\tealE7.0\purpleD{7}$.

question.content: **What is $5.071$ in words?**

options.content: Five and seventy-one hundredths
Five thousand seventy-one
Five and seventy-one thousandths

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to show $5.071$.  The last place value in the number is *thousandths*, so the number ends in the *thousandths* place.  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths| Thousandths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | $\goldD{5}$ |$.$  | $\greenD0$ | $\purpleC{7}$ | $\maroonD{1}$
The number $\goldD{5}$ is to the left of the decimal, so we can write it as $\text{\goldD{five}}$.  $\text{\goldD{Five}}-$
We can represent the decimal with the word $\blueD{\text{and}}$.  $\text{\goldD{Five}\blueD{ and}}-$
$.0\purpleC{7}\maroonD{1}$ is to the right of the decimal and ends in the *thousandths* place.  $\text{\purpleC{Seventy-}}\text{\maroonD{one}}\text{\maroonD{ thousandths}}$
We write $5.071$ in words as $\text{\goldD{five}{ and}}\text{\purpleC{ seventy-}}\text{\maroonD{one}}\text{\maroonD{ thousandths}}$.

$.\maroonD{5}$ is to the right of the decimal and ends in the *tenths* place.  $\text{\maroonD{Five tenths}}$

We can represent the decimal with the word $\blueD{\text{and}}$.  $\text{\goldD{Eight thousand}}\text{\greenD{ twenty-}}\text{\redD{four}}\text{\blueD{ and}}-$
$.\purpleC{6}\maroonD{2}$ is to the right of the decimal and ends in the *hundredths* place.  $\text{\purpleC{Sixty-}}\text{\maroonD{two}}\text{\maroonD{ hundredths}}$

We write $8{,}024.62$ in words as $\text{\goldD{eight thousand}}\text{\greenD{ twenty-}}\text{\redD{four}}\text{\blueD{ and}} \text{\purpleC{ sixty-}}\text{\maroonD{two}}\text{\maroonD{ hundredths}}$.

$.\maroonD{9}$ is to the right of the decimal and ends in the *tenths* place.  $\text{\maroonD{Nine tenths}}$

question.content: **Match the written form and decimal form that describe the same number.**

hints.content: Let's use a place value chart to look at each written form one at a time.    $\goldD{\text{Five}} {\text{ and }} \purpleC{\text{three hundredths}}$  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths | Hundredths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-: | :-:  | $\goldD{5}$ |$.$  | $0$ | $\purpleC{3}$   $\goldD{\text{Five}} {\text{ and }} \purpleC{\text{three hundredths}} = \goldD{5}.0\purpleC{3}$

$\goldD{\text{Five}} {\text{ and }} \greenD{\text{three tenths}}$  Tens | Ones | $.$ | Tenths :-:|:-: | :-: | :-:  | $\goldD{5}$ |$.$  | $\greenD3$  $\goldD{\text{Five}} {\text{ and }} \greenD{\text{three tenths}} = \goldD{5}.\greenD{3}$
$\blueD{\text{Fifty-}} \goldD{\text{three}}$  Tens | Ones :-:|:-: | :-:  $\blueD{5}$ | $\goldD{3}$  $\blueD{\text{Fifty-}} \goldD{\text{three}} =\blueD{5}\goldD{3}$
The answer:  Written form | Decimal form :-: | :-:  Five and three hundredths | $5.03$ Five and three tenths | $5.3$ Fifty-three | $53$
